comment: This class wasn't that hard unless you have HORRIBLE time management. It was very easy to get through the semester. When she says put a quote from the textbook, DO IT. If not she'll take off a good chuck on your papers. Just try to stay involved in the discussion and complete everything before the next week.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: Amazing teacher. I was in a car accident and she gave me an extension on my assignments so that I could make it up. We worked on one paper throughout the semester. Every week there was 1-2 assignments to complete. She also gave great feedback, and offers help if you email her. AMAZING TEACHER!!!! I will be taking her for my other English class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: I added this class during the add drop period & as a freshman on my 2nd day of class, she made me read aloud an email that I didn't see from her that said to come in a few minutes early to look at the syllabus. then!! she lectured me in front of everyone on the importance of reading your emails. I will forever remember how horrible that felt. mean!

Prof. Matthews does what a college professor is supposed to do; she gives you the info., and you decide how you want to learn it. While she doesn't sugarcoat anything, she can make college seem intimidating. She has a good sense of humor, but it is slightly insulting at times. She expects you to remember minute details and will talk down to you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Class is mostly busy-work, but she takes it very seriously. It's harder than it should be but show up, get her to like you and turn stuff in on time. You'll be good.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Super nice and funny. Easy class but has a few projects which are somewhat challenging but all the KSU1101 classes do them. We used the textbook to do part of a project and you need the pages to write on and turn in.

Professor Matthews seems like a nice person, but she is not a good professor. This class is meant to teach college students how to deal with college, not overload them with useless assignments. She tends to have a sassy attitude and has favorites. Don't take her. You shouldn't have to stress so much over a Seminar class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I absolutely adore Professor Matthews. She does expect you to read the assigned chapters before class and respond to her questions. If you make a good impression on the first day and actually respond to her questions, you shouldn't have a problem at all. She is willing to work to you and is a very caring professor.

I loved Professor Matthews as a person, she truly cares about all her students and their futures. Her class is an easy A if you do the work. A majority of your grades come from out of class work and your midterm and final. The assignments were easy, straight forward, and interesting. Time management is key in this class.

She has an odd personality and I never really knew where I stood with her. She cares about her students in the bigger picture. I appreciated that about her, especially that this was a freshman seminar class. She picks on everyone so just beware of that if you're sensitive to being called out on things. Easy A, show up to class.

Professor Matthews is one of the most dedicated people I have ever met. She is very intimidating but truly cares about her students. She makes an effort to get to know her students at a personal level. She does a lot of work from the book and there are a ton of assignments throughout the course. Always be sure to check D2L for hidden assignments!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Matthews may have a bit of an intimidating personality at first but once you get to know her she really cares about the students and their getting aquainted with the campus. Make sure to remember to post on her disussion boards on D2L. She expects participation in class but nothing out of the norm of how a college student should be.

Very easy class as long as you attend and make an attempt to interact with her and other students. Assignments aren't too tough and seem more like busy work, but some are more fun than expected and you can make good friends to start college. If you get on her good side and work with her this class should be relatively easy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Wouldn't recommend taking her.  She's tough, she will tear you apart in presentations no matter how hard you work. Don't take one day a week either you'll be up to your eyes in homework and goodNess gracious the group projects. Get ready for them. They won't end. Right when you think they will. There's another waiting.
Great Teacher! Had her for KSU 1101. Very helpful, but you have to meet her halfway. Great sense of humor.

This professor makes you wonder why KSU offers a first-year seminar at all. She is inefficient,TERRIBLE with grades, and really good at creating awkward moments by saying off-color comments. She doesn't have enough material to get through the semester, so she makes it up as she goes. Avoid this professor if you can.

I thought she was nice, but you have to be on her good side. She talks a lot about things that have nothing to do with English, but her class is extremely easy. She's helpful in class, but if you send her an e-mail, it might take a while to respond. I did like her class, though

This professor definitely knows her material. She picks favorites but she will probably call everyone out on something at least once, whether she hates/loves you. I feel like we had class really just so she could hear herself talk. Stuck to the class schedule well. Lots of things due all at once. Not very clear on due dates on online discussions.

I had Mrs.Matthews for Honors English and I can truly say I enjoyed the class. She follows the syllabus/calendar closely (if she has changes she will notify you.) She is always open for questions and discussion. She gives helpful comments on papers and is understanding. You are expected to read for class but it is reasonable. I would reccomend her!
get on her good side.

Did not like her method of teaching. Not very clear with her grading. She is rude when she wants to be. I had to do more work in her class than in any other class. Do not take her one day a week, she will give you TONS of work to do. You have been warned.
She is not very clear with the work.

KNOWS WHAT SHE IS TALKING ABOUT! What some students may not like about her is that SHE EXPECTS YOU TO BE A COLLEGE STUDENT! Work hard/take yourself and your work seriously and you will do fine. Can seem intimidating, but speak to her outside of the classroom to find that she is one of the most caring teachers at KSU. A GOOD PERSON TO KNOW! *hint*
This was very rude. She did not show favoritism, because she disliked everyone equally
No Comments

I loved her. She really worked on the classes knowledge of each other. We played games to get to know one another. Most of the work seemed pointless but I did learn some new material. I would recommend her. You will have to work hard but it's college guys. I got an A in the class and didn't even read the second book! :-)

Horrible teacher  Drop the class!!!!!!!   it is easy work but there is soooooooooo much of it. She is a total B**** if she doesnt like you. Teaching methods rediculously stupid, learned nothing of any use.

She is a great teacher once you get used to her character! But it is true, her class does consist of TONS of work, but once you get passed it and you do all of your work, she is an easy A. She is very interested in her students and there academic goals.
i hated every minute of her class
She is GREAT. funny, smart, and yeah theres work, but we're not supossed to come to college and sleep. love her!

This was the most annoying class i have ever taken!!!  All she did was talk about the struggle of women and African Americans, which normally wouldn't be a problem, however I was taking 1101 not women's or African American history.  The class overall is easy.  You have to be in class or she takes it off your grade.  Too much work and very boring!!!
teaching methods sucked
One of my favorite teachers at KSU. Took me a little while to get used to her but she is very warm and knowledgeable once accept her as she is with all her quirks. Definetely my most memorable class!

A very helpful and laid back professor! Yes, a lot of work, but VERY EASY WORK! Those who complain are just LAZY! An easy A in this class. You will learn about the history of KSU and all the resourses that are available to you as a student!
No Comments
Everything you hear is true, worst teacher EVER. This class is suppose to be an intro to KSU, WRONG!!! Loads of work, not fun, and she wrote the book

She was the most enlightened Professor I've had. No ego's, she wants you to get the most out of the University. The Freshman Seminare made me knowledgable about the University. She wants to know you can think out of the "box", so open your mind.
Yes it was alot of work. But we are in college ae we not? She is fair, and she prepares you for what's to come
Be prepared to read and discuss black women in history.  Everything seems to go back to the struggles of black women.  Very critical unless she likes your writings.

LOTS of work, 2 projects in the last 4 weeks of class alone. doesn't explain anything. tons more work than any other ksu 1101 class (oh yeah, and she helped write the book - be ready for a ksu history quiz)
she seems nice, but the class is sooooo boring...she wrote the book...seriouslly
OMG!!!! SHE GIVES SOOO MUCH FREAKIN WORK! and she doesnt even explain it!!
No Comments
